diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Alcohol withdrawal, Asthma exacerbation, Hypomagnesemia, Thrombocytopenia
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Patient presented with nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and inability to take oral intake. History of alcohol dependence and previous DTs with seizures. Physical examination revealed mild epigastric tenderness but no signs of other acute abdominal conditions. Previous diagnoses included alcohol withdrawal and asthma exacerbation, but the acute pancreatitis was determined as the primary issue given the symptoms.
